title: Google\Cloud\NetworkConnectivity\V1\Hub
name: Hub
description:
A hub is a collection of spokes. A single hub can contain spokes from multiple regions. However, if any of a hub's spokes use the data transfer feature, the resources associated with those spokes must all reside in the same VPC network. Spokes that do not use data transfer can be associated with any VPC network in your project.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.networkconnectivity.v1.Hub

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Immutable. The name of the hub. Hub names must be unique. They use the following form: projects/{project_number}/locations/global/hubs/{hub_id}

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The time the hub was created.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. The time the hub was last updated.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Optional labels in key:value format. For more information about labels, see Requirements for labels.

params.name: data.unique_id
params.description: Output only. The Google-generated UUID for the hub. This value is unique across all hub resources. If a hub is deleted and another with the same name is created, the new hub is assigned a different unique_id.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. The current lifecycle state of this hub.

params.name: data.routing_vpcs
params.description: The VPC networks associated with this hub's spokes. This field is read-only. Network Connectivity Center automatically populates it based on the set of spokes attached to the hub.
